PARAGRAPH.STRING: (pronounced [IPA: /'kænədə/] in English and [IPA: /kanada/] in French) is the world's second-largest country by total area, occupying most of northern North America. Extending from the Atlantic Ocean to the Pacific Ocean and northward into the Arctic Ocean,
shares land borders with the United States to the south and to the northwest.
was founded as a union of British and former French colonies.
gained independence from the United Kingdom in an incremental process that began in 1867 and ended in 1982.
is a federal constitutional monarchy with a parliamentary democracy. Comprising ten provinces and three territories,
is a bilingual and multicultural nation, with both English and French as official languages at the federal level. A technologically advanced and industrialized nation,
maintains a diversified economy heavily reliant on trade—particularly with the United States, with which
has had a long and complex relationship—and abundant natural resources.
